intro: Lindernia shichengensis, commonly known as the Shicheng Lindernia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet to purple blooms, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
